intro: Drimys lenormandii, commonly known as the Chilean wintergreen, is a small evergreen shrub native to the temperate rainforests of southern Chile. It belongs to the family Winteraceae, which is one of the oldest plant families, dating back to the Mesozoic era. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, elliptical leaves and small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in late winter. Its fruits are drupes, containing a single seed, and the plant is adapted to thrive in cool, moist, and shaded environments. Drimys lenormandii is also notable for its medicinal uses by indigenous peoples of Chile.
